com.skysql.monitor
Class mondata

java.lang.Object
  com.skysql.monitor.mondata

public class mondata
extends java.lang.Object

Interface to the monitoring database, this is the database that holds the definition of what to monitor and into which the monitored values are written.

Author:
Mark Riddoch

Method Detail

connect

public java.sql.Connection connect()
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
Connect to the SQLite database. This routine connects to a SQLite database, returning the new connection to the caller. Multiple attempts are made to connect to the database, with a back-off algorithm, in order to allow for problems connecting due to resource locking issues in SQLite.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

getMonitorSQL

public java.lang.String getMonitorSQL(int monitor_id)
Get the SQL command (or command string) associated with a particular monitor. Although originally a simple SQL string for a monitor to execute, other monitor types have reused the string to contain monitor specific data.

Parameters:
monitor_id - The monitor ID to return the SQL data string for
Returns:
The "SQL" field of the monitor

monitorIsDelta

public java.lang.Boolean monitorIsDelta(int monitor_id)
Is the monitored value a cumulative number or a snapshot value. This allows monitors to return values that are either the value in the database or the difference between the current value and the previous value.

Parameters:
monitor_id - The monitor ID to check
Returns:
True of the monitor is a delta of observed values

monitorInterval

public int monitorInterval()
Fetch the monitor probe interval

Returns:
The monitor interval in seconds

getNamedMonitor

public int getNamedMonitor(java.lang.String name)
Fetch the name of a particular monitor

Parameters:
name - The monitor name
Returns:
The monitor_id of the named monitor or -1 if the monitor was not found

getMonitorType

public java.lang.String getMonitorType(int id)
Return the type, and hence monitor class, of a particular monitor.

Parameters:
id - The monitor ID
Returns:
The type field for the monitor, e.g. SQL, CMD, CRM etc.

getMonitorSystemAverage

public boolean getMonitorSystemAverage(int id)
Is the system monitor value cumulative or an average of all the nodes in the system

Parameters:
id - The Monitor ID
Returns:
True if the system value of a monitor is an average of all the nodes in the system

                           java.lang.String publicIP)

setPrivateIP

public boolean setPrivateIP(java.lang.String instanceID,
                            java.lang.String privateIP)
setPrivateIP - Update the private IP of an instance. Only update the database if the new value differs from that already stored.

Parameters:
instanceID - The instanceID as a string
privateIP - The current private IP address
Returns:
boolean True if the IP address changed

IPMonitor

public boolean IPMonitor()
IPMonitor Get the system property IPMonitor - this controls the running of the IPMonitor for EC2 Cloud based deployments. The default is true for reasons of backward compatibility

Returns:
boolean True if the IP Monitor should be run

monitorData

public boolean monitorData(int systemID,
                           int nodeID,
                           int monitorID,
                           java.lang.String observation)
Interface to record monitor observed values. This differs from the other entry points in that it passes the data onto the API.

Parameters:
systemID - The SystemID to update
nodeID - The NodeID to update
monitorID - The moitorID the value is associated with
observation - The observed value
Returns:
True if the monitor observation was written

monitorData

public boolean monitorData(int systemID,
                           int monitorID,
                           java.lang.String observation)
Interface to record observed values for a system. This differs from the other entry points in that it passes the data onto the API.

Parameters:
systemID - The SystemID to update
monitorID - The MonitorID the value is associated with
observation - The observed value
Returns:
True if the monitor observation was written
